ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: where no prattle is ever heard.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: wherein they shall hear no vain talk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: wherein they will not hear any vain talk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In which they will not hear any lewd speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Where they shall neither hear harmful speech nor falsehood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Wherein you shall not hear vain talk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Where they hear no idle speech,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: where they will hear no idle talk,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They shall hear therein no vain discourse;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: where they will not hear any vain talk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Where they shall hear no (word) of vanity:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Where they shall neither hear harmful speech nor falsehood,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: where they will hear no idle talk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: In it you will hear no nonsense.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [88:11] in which they will not hear (read lā yusma‘u, ‘will not be heard’, or lā tasma‘u, ‘they will not hear’) any vanity, any inane soul, speaking drivel;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Where) in Paradise (they hear no idle speech) any oath whether it is true or false,
